intro: Gymnogramma martensii, commonly known as the Martens' shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, pinnately divided fronds that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in clusters called sori. Gymnogramma martensii is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas.
